question: Which of the following correctly define Corals?
option1: A particular type of shell found near some of the seacoasts
option2: A special variety of fish which live in shells
option3: The tiny animals that live in shells in the sea
option4: The remains of tiny sea animals resembling shells
answer: The remains of tiny sea animals resembling shells
explanation: Corals are marine invertebrates within the class Anthozoa of the phylum Cnidaria. They typically live in compact colonies of many identical individual polyps. Corals species include the important reef builders that inhabit tropical. Although some corals are able to catch small fish and plankton using stinging cells.
